    Model typical behaviour and Estimate Lower Extreme Threshold

    model_extremes.Rd

    Fits an ARIMA model on a subset of the time series representing "typical" behavior and estimates a lower extreme threshold based on either Extreme Value Theory (EVT) using the Generalized Pareto Distribution (GPD) or a boxplot-based approach.

    model_extremes(
  full_data,
  time_col,
  typical_start,
  typical_end,
  response,
  tail_prob = 0.05,
  t_method = c("evd", "boxplot")
)

    Arguments

    full_data

    A tsibble object containing at least a time index column a response variable to be modeled.

    time_col

    Name of the time index column.

    typical_start

    Start date-time (character or POSIXct) defining the beginning of the typical observation window used for model fitting.

    typical_end

    End date-time (character or POSIXct) defining the end of the typical observation window.

    response

    The response variable to model, passed as an unquoted column name.

    tail_prob

    Numeric value (default = 0.05). Tail probability used for defining the lower extreme threshold when `t_method = "evd"`.

    t_method

    Character string indicating the threshold estimation method. Options are:

    • `"evd"` — estimates the threshold using the Generalized Pareto Distribution.

    • `"boxplot"` — uses the boxplot rule (1.5 × IQR below Q1) to identify lower extremes.

    Value

    A list containing:

    model

    The fitted ARIMA model object.

    lower_limit

    The estimated lower extreme threshold.

    threshold_method

    The threshold estimation method used (`"evd"` or `"boxplot"`).

    fitted_subset

    The subset of the time series used for model fitting.

    full_data

    The original full dataset provided.

    response

    The response variable name.

    Details

    The function first subsets the input time series between `typical_start` and `typical_end` to capture non-extreme, representative behavior. An ARIMA model is automatically fitted using the `fable` framework, and residuals are extracted.

    Depending on the chosen `t_method`, the lower extreme threshold is estimated:

    • For `"evd"` — the Generalized Pareto Distribution is fitted to the lower tail of residuals using fpot() from the evd package.

    • For `"boxplot"` — the lower whisker (Q1 − 1.5 × IQR) is used as the threshold.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Create a sample daily time series dataset (use Date, not POSIXct)
data <- tsibble::tsibble(
  date = seq.Date(as.Date("2020-01-01"), as.Date("2020-12-31"), by = "day"),
  value = rnorm(366),
  index = date
)

# Run the model_extremes function
result <- model_extremes(
  full_data = data,
  time_col = date,
  typical_start = "2020-01-01",
  typical_end = "2020-06-30",
  response = value,
  tail_prob = 0.05,
  t_method = "evd"
)
} # }
